Boston.com
10

Brown releasing tax returns, challenges Warren to match

Senator Scott Brown plans to release six years of returns, his campaign said in a letter pressuring challenger Elizabeth Warren to do the same. (Globe, 11:39 a.m.)
  • Brown’s tax comments may pose problems for Romney
  • Discuss What do you make of the Brown-Warren tax flap?
Coverage of the US Senate race in Mass.

Body of missing Nantucket woman ID'd

Human remains found Friday in Falmouth belong to Trudie Hall, missing since 2010, who was pregnant and was shot multiple times, the DA said. (Globe, 10:53 a.m.)
First ladies of Boston sports | Pictures

Youkilis now a Brady brother-in-law

Tom Brady's sister, Julie (pictured, left) married Kevin Youkilis, making her the latest addition to our collection featuring the better halves of Boston sports celebrities.
  • Names: Kevin Youkilis, Julie Brady tie knot

Mass. home sales up 20 percent in March

Single-family home sales rose last month compared to March 2011, but median prices fell for a sixth straight month, the Warren Group reported. (Globe, 6:30 a.m.)
  • Fed likely to keep stance on rates and bond buys

Monday's heavy rain set a Boston record

Boston recorded 1.48 inches of rain yesterday, breaking the previous April 23 record of 1.14 inches, set in 1998, the National Weather Service said. (Globe, 9:58 a.m.)
  • Weather Wisdom: Partly sunny, gusty wind | Forecast

What's a tooth worth now?

A shiny quarter just doesn't cut it anymore. What was once merely a diversion from the mild trauma of losing a tooth has turned into a serious gift-giving occasion. (Boston Globe)
  • Something to chew on: Tooth Fairy gift national average
  • submit How much does your Tooth Fairy give per tooth?

3.2m in Mass. have had data lost, stolen

Nearly half of Mass. residents have reportedly had their personal information lost or stolen as a result of about 1,800 data breaches over the past four years. (Globe)

for home court

Daily Dose

Giuliana Rancic opts for surrogacy

After undergoing failed attempts at IVF and treatment for breast cancer, TV reality star and E! News host Giuliana Rancic said one of the embryos she’d previously frozen was implanted in a woman who agreed to carry the fetus.
